About me.

I am a 4th year applied statistics major at UC Davis and will be graduating in Spring 2017. I plan on pursuing a career in data science and I am also interested in an actuarial career. Inspired by the class I took, I decide to create this data science portfolio to keep track on my works and the progress of myself becoming a better data scientist.

Interesting classes that I took:

  1. STA 141A - Statistical Data Science (R Language)
  2. STA 141B - Statistical Data Technologies (Python)
  3. STA 135 - Multivariate Data Analysis
  4. STA 137 - Applied Time Series Analysis (R Language)
  5. STA 138 - Analysis Categorical Data (SAS & R)
  6. ECS 030 - Programming & Problem Solving in C
  7. ECS 010 - Intro to Programming (Python)

Projects that I worked on:

  • Statistical Data Analysis on fatal police shootings in the US
    • - analyzed the Washington Post Fatal Police Shooting data set and determine any correlations between the variables by using R.
  • Categorical Data Analysis of Survival in the Titanic Voyage
    • - examined various models in a categorial dataset by using R and SAS.
  • A Logistic Regression of Coronary Heart Disease
    • - explored the relationship between age and the presence or absence of Coronary Heart Disease in the sample by using R and SAS.
  • Time Series Analysis on Milk Production
    • - analyzed and forecast the time models in the milk dataset by using R.
